thread.title: Setters Lose Thrilling 3-2 Match Against SNHU in NE10 Clash
thread.title_full: Setters Lose Thrilling 3-2 Match Against SNHU in NE10 Clash

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Setters Lose Thrilling 3-2 Match Against SNHU in NE10 Clash
text:
Setters Lose Thrilling 3-2 Match Against SNHU in NE10 Clash
Pace University's field hockey team narrowly lost to Southern New Hampshire University, finishing the game 3-2 in a competitive Northeast 10 Conference matchup. The Setters started strong, scoring just 59 seconds into the game, but struggled as the Penmen rallied with two crucial fourth-quarter goals. Despite the defense's efforts and a late goal from freshman Feline Rook, the Setters were unable to equalize before the final whistle. With this loss, Pace's overall record is now 6-9, and they stand at 5-4 in conference play. The team will honor their seniors during their next home game against Saint Michael's College this Saturday.
- Pace held a 11-9 advantage in penalty corners.
- Goalkeeper Morgan Strecker made 6 saves during the match.
- Pace is currently 6-9 overall and 5-4 in the conference.
- Only three games remain in the regular season, including their next match against Saint Michael's College.
The Setters will focus on regrouping as they prepare for their upcoming game against Saint Michael's College, a crucial match that will impact their postseason hopes.
Bottom LinePace's close defeat highlights the need for improved offensive execution in the final minutes, as they look to secure crucial wins in their remaining games.
Read more at Pace University Athletics
